summary.purpose: Provides a comprehensive set of accessible dialog (modal) components built on Radix UI's Dialog primitive, including overlay, content container, header, footer, title, and description components with consistent styling and animations.
summary.problem_solved: Simplifies building accessible, animated modal dialogs by providing pre-styled composable components (Dialog, DialogTrigger, DialogContent, DialogOverlay, DialogHeader, DialogFooter, DialogTitle, DialogDescription, DialogClose, DialogPortal) that handle focus management, keyboard interactions, and animations automatically through Radix UI.

external.name: react
external.why_used: Core React library for component creation, forwardRef, and JSX rendering

external.name: @radix-ui/react-dialog
external.why_used: Provides accessible Dialog primitive components (Root, Trigger, Portal, Overlay, Content, Close, Title, Description) with built-in focus management and keyboard handling

external.name: lucide-react
external.why_used: Provides the X (close) icon component for the dialog close button

internal.why_used: Provides the cn() utility function for conditionally merging CSS classes

exports.name: Dialog
exports.description_one_line: Dialog root component wrapper around Radix UI DialogPrimitive.Root for managing dialog state

exports.name: DialogTrigger
exports.description_one_line: Dialog trigger component that opens the dialog when clicked

exports.name: DialogPortal
exports.description_one_line: Dialog portal component that renders dialog content outside the normal DOM hierarchy

exports.name: DialogClose
exports.description_one_line: Dialog close component for triggering dialog closure

exports.name: DialogOverlay
exports.description_one_line: Styled overlay component that covers the page behind the dialog with dark semi-transparent background

exports.name: DialogContent
exports.description_one_line: Main dialog content container with centered positioning, animations, and built-in close button

exports.name: DialogHeader
exports.description_one_line: Dialog header container for positioning title and description at the top of the dialog

exports.name: DialogFooter
exports.description_one_line: Dialog footer container for action buttons positioned at the bottom with responsive layout

exports.name: DialogTitle
exports.description_one_line: Styled dialog title component wrapping Radix UI DialogPrimitive.Title

exports.name: DialogDescription
exports.description_one_line: Styled dialog description component for secondary text below the title

symbols.name: Dialog
symbols.description_one_line: Root dialog component managing open/closed state and containing all dialog sub-components

details.what_it_does: Alias for DialogPrimitive.Root. Manages the dialog's open/closed state and coordinates all child components (trigger, content, overlay, etc.). All other dialog components must be placed within this root component.

minimal_correct.title: Basic dialog with trigger and content
minimal_correct.code:
import { Dialog, DialogTrigger, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogDescription } from 'akeyless-client-commons/components/ui';

const MyDialog = () => (
  <Dialog>
    <DialogTrigger asChild>
      <button>Open Dialog</button>
    </DialogTrigger>
    <DialogContent>
      <DialogHeader>
        <DialogTitle>Dialog Title</DialogTitle>
        <DialogDescription>Dialog description goes here</DialogDescription>
      </DialogHeader>
    </DialogContent>
  </Dialog>
);

extensive_correct.title: Complete dialog with header, footer, and actions

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Missing Dialog wrapper
incorrect.why_incorrect: All dialog sub-components must be rendered within a Dialog root component. Without it, the dialog state management and accessibility features won't work. Always wrap your dialog UI with <Dialog>.

symbols.name: DialogTrigger
symbols.description_one_line: Button or element that triggers dialog opening when clicked

details.what_it_does: Alias for DialogPrimitive.Trigger. Acts as the clickable element that opens the dialog. Can be any button or element. Use asChild prop to render as a different element type.

extensive_correct.title: Trigger as custom button with styling
extensive_correct.code:
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger asChild>
    <button className="px-4 py-2 bg-blue-500 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-600">
      Open Settings
    </button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  {/* Dialog content */}
</Dialog>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Nested trigger inside another element
incorrect.why_incorrect: While this works, DialogTrigger should typically be a direct child of Dialog for best accessibility. If you need wrapper div, use asChild prop instead.

symbols.name: DialogPortal
symbols.description_one_line: Portal component that renders dialog content outside the normal DOM hierarchy

details.what_it_does: Alias for DialogPrimitive.Portal. Renders its children outside the normal DOM tree, typically to avoid CSS stacking context issues. DialogContent automatically uses Portal internally.

minimal_correct.title: Portal usage (usually not needed directly)

extensive_correct.title: Custom portal with multiple content areas

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Unnecessary nested portals
incorrect.why_incorrect: Nesting multiple Portal components is unnecessary and inefficient. Use Portal once to escape the normal DOM hierarchy.

symbols.name: DialogClose
symbols.description_one_line: Alias for DialogPrimitive.Close, closes the dialog when interacted with

details.what_it_does: Alias for DialogPrimitive.Close. Any element wrapped with this component will close the dialog when clicked. Typically used for close buttons in the header or footer.

extensive_correct.title: Multiple close triggers
extensive_correct.code:
{/* Close button in header */}
Confirm Action
{/* Content */}

Are you sure?

{/* Close in footer */}

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using DialogClose outside Dialog
incorrect.code: // This won't close anything
incorrect.why_incorrect: DialogClose must be inside a Dialog component to function. It relies on the Dialog's state context to trigger closure.

symbols.name: DialogOverlay
symbols.description_one_line: Styled overlay component rendering a dark semi-transparent background behind the dialog

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default overlay styles using cn() utility

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard Radix UI Overlay props and HTML div attributes

returns.description: A styled overlay element with fixed positioning and fade animations

details.what_it_does: Renders a fixed-position overlay element covering the entire viewport behind the dialog. Pre-styled with semi-transparent black background (bg-black/80) and fade-in/fade-out animations. Uses forwardRef to expose the underlying element reference.
details.rendered_ui_description: A full-screen fixed overlay with black color at 80% opacity. Animates in smoothly when dialog opens and fades out when dialog closes. Prevents interaction with page content behind the dialog.

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Overlay without Content
incorrect.code:
// Overlay alone won't close dialog
<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger>Open</DialogTrigger>
  <DialogOverlay onClick={() => {}} />
</Dialog>
incorrect.why_incorrect: Overlay is typically used inside DialogContent which handles all interactions. Standalone overlay without proper dialog structure won't function correctly.

symbols.name: DialogContent
symbols.description_one_line: Main dialog content container with centered positioning, animations, and built-in close button

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default content styles

params.name: children
params.description: Dialog content (header, body, footer components and text)

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard Radix UI Content props and HTML div attributes

returns.description: A styled centered dialog container with overlay, animations, and close button

details.what_it_does: Main dialog container component. Renders a portal with overlay and centered content box. Automatically includes a close button (X icon) in the top-right corner. Uses fixed positioning with transform centering (translate -50% -50%). Includes animations for opening (fade-in, zoom-in, slide-in) and closing (fade-out, zoom-out, slide-out). Max-width is limited to lg (32rem).
details.rendered_ui_description: A centered white box with max-width 32rem, positioned in the middle of the viewport with semi-transparent dark overlay behind it. Top-right corner has a close button (X icon). Content area has padding and subtle box shadow. Smoothly animates in when dialog opens and animates out when closing. On desktop, has rounded corners (sm:rounded-lg).

minimal_correct.title: Basic dialog content with header and title

extensive_correct.title: Complete dialog with all sections
extensive_correct.code: Settings Manage your application preferences

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Overlapping dialog and content styling
incorrect.why_incorrect: DialogContent already includes and manages the overlay internally. Adding a custom overlay inside will cause visual duplication and interaction conflicts. The overlay is automatically positioned and animated.

symbols.name: DialogHeader
symbols.description_one_line: Container component for positioning dialog title and description at the top of the dialog

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default header layout styles

returns.description: A styled div container for header content

details.what_it_does: Layout component that positions its children (typically DialogTitle and DialogDescription) with flexbox in a column direction with vertical spacing. Uses text-center on mobile and text-left on tablet and above (sm breakpoint). Useful for grouping heading content at the top of the dialog.
details.rendered_ui_description: A flex column container with small vertical gaps (space-y-1.5) between children. Text is centered on mobile and left-aligned on larger screens. No background or borders - purely for layout and spacing.

extensive_correct.title: Header with title and description
extensive_correct.code:
<DialogContent>
  <DialogHeader>
    <DialogTitle>User Settings</DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      Update your profile information and preferences
    </DialogDescription>
  </DialogHeader>
  {/* Body content */}
</DialogContent>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using Header for body content
incorrect.code:
// Don't put form fields in header
<DialogHeader>
  <Input placeholder="Search..." />
  <Button>Find</Button>
</DialogHeader>
incorrect.why_incorrect: DialogHeader is for title/description only. Use the dialog body for form fields and interactive content.

symbols.name: DialogFooter
symbols.description_one_line: Container component for action buttons positioned at the bottom of the dialog with responsive layout

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default footer layout styles

returns.description: A styled div container for footer content

details.what_it_does: Layout component that positions action buttons with flexbox. On mobile (default), displays buttons in column-reverse order (bottom button first). On tablet and above (sm breakpoint), displays buttons in a row with right alignment and spacing between them. Useful for grouping action buttons (like OK/Cancel) at the bottom of the dialog.
details.rendered_ui_description: A flex container that stacks buttons vertically on mobile (reverse column order) and horizontally on desktop (right-aligned row). Buttons automatically have consistent spacing via justify-end and space-x-2 on larger screens.

extensive_correct.title: Footer with multiple action buttons
extensive_correct.code:
Confirm Action

Are you sure you want to proceed?

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using Footer for content
incorrect.code:
// Don't put paragraphs/text in footer

This is body content, not a button
incorrect.why_incorrect: DialogFooter is for action buttons. Body content and descriptions should go in the main dialog body, not in the footer.

symbols.name: DialogTitle
symbols.description_one_line: Styled dialog title component for the main heading of the dialog

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default title styles

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard Radix UI Title props and HTML heading attributes

returns.description: A styled heading element with large font size and semibold weight

details.what_it_does: Renders a styled dialog title using Radix UI's DialogPrimitive.Title. Applies text styling: text-lg (large), font-semibold (600 weight), leading-none (no line-height), and tracking-tight (tight letter spacing). Uses forwardRef for direct element access. Should be placed inside DialogHeader.
details.rendered_ui_description: A large (text-lg), semibold heading with tight letter spacing and no extra line height. Renders as an h2 element by default. Dark color with good contrast against light backgrounds.

extensive_correct.title: Title with custom styling
extensive_correct.code:
<DialogContent>
  <DialogHeader>
    <DialogTitle className="text-xl font-bold text-red-600">
      Warning: Destructive Action
    </DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      This action cannot be undone
    </DialogDescription>
  </DialogHeader>
</DialogContent>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using Title outside DialogHeader
incorrect.why_incorrect: DialogTitle should be placed inside DialogHeader for proper semantic structure and layout. The header container provides the correct spacing and alignment.

symbols.name: DialogDescription
symbols.description_one_line: Styled dialog description component for secondary text below the title

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default description styles

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard Radix UI Description props and HTML div attributes

returns.description: A styled paragraph element with smaller font and muted color

details.what_it_does: Renders a styled dialog description using Radix UI's DialogPrimitive.Description. Applies text styling: text-sm (smaller), text-muted-foreground (gray/muted color). Uses forwardRef for direct element access. Typically placed below DialogTitle inside DialogHeader.
details.rendered_ui_description: A smaller (text-sm), muted gray text element. Usually appears below the title in the dialog header. Uses secondary text color that has sufficient contrast but is visually subordinate to the title.

extensive_correct.title: Description with detailed explanation
extensive_correct.code:
<DialogContent>
  <DialogHeader>
    <DialogTitle>Export Data</DialogTitle>
    <DialogDescription>
      Choose the format and fields you want to include in your export. The file will be downloaded automatically.
    </DialogDescription>
  </DialogHeader>
  {/* Form fields for export options */}
</DialogContent>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Using Description as body content
incorrect.code:
// Don't put form fields in description
<DialogDescription>
  <Input placeholder="Search..." />
  <Button>Filter</Button>
</DialogDescription>
incorrect.why_incorrect: DialogDescription is for subtitle text only. Form fields and interactive content should be in the main dialog body, not the description.
